paras.en: Some kids have actually come out and asked me why I hang out with "the freak" so much. These are kids that don't even know him well. If they knew him, they wouldn't call him that. "Because he's a nice kid!" I always answer. "And don't call him that." "You're a saint, Summer," Ximena Chin said to me the other day. "I couldn't do what you're doing." "It's not a big deal," I answered her truthfully. "Did Mr. Tushman ask you to be friends with him?" Charlotte Cody asked. "No. I'm friends with him because I want to be friends with him," I answered. Who knew that my sitting with August Pullman at lunch would be such a big deal? People acted like it was the strangest thing in the world. It's weird how weird kids can be.
paras.cn: 有些孩子真的会直接问我为什么我那么常和“那个怪物”一起玩。这些都是甚至不怎么了解他的孩子。如果他们了解他，他们就不会那样叫他。“因为他是个好孩子！” 我总是回答。“而且别那样叫他。” “你真是个圣人，萨默，” 西梅纳·陈前几天对我说。“我做不到你正在做的事。” “没什么大不了的，” 我如实回答她。“是塔什曼先生让你和他做朋友的吗？” 夏洛特·科迪问。“不。我和他做朋友是因为我想和他做朋友，” 我回答。谁能想到我在午餐时和奥古斯特·普尔曼坐在一起会是这么大一件事？人们表现得好像那是世界上最奇怪的事。孩子们能有多奇怪，真是奇怪。

vocab.ex: After weeks of silence, she finally came out and asked him what was wrong.
He likes to hang out with his friends on the weekend.
The bullies called him a freak just because he dressed differently.
She's a complete saint for taking care of all those stray animals.
Don't worry about breaking the glass; it's not a big deal.
It's weird that the store is closed on a Tuesday.

gram.name: 第二条件句（用于推理）
gram.function: 用于描述一个与现在事实相反的假设情况及其可能的结果。'If they knew him, they wouldn't call him that' 提出了一个假设（如果他们了解他），并推断出与现实（他们确实那样叫他）相反的结果，以此来为朋友辩护。

example.en: If she were here, she would know what to do.
example.cn: 如果她在这里，她就会知道该怎么做了。

gram.constraints: 条件从句用一般过去时，主句用 'would/could/should/might + 动词原形'。

paras.en: I sat with him that first day because I felt sorry for him. That's all. Here he was, this strange-looking kid in a brandnew school. No one was talking to him. Everyone was staring at him. All the girls at my table were whispering about him. He wasn't the only new kid at Beecher Prep, but he was the only one everyone was talking about. Julian had nicknamed him the Zombie Kid, and that's what everyone was calling him. "Did you see the Zombie Kid yet?" Stuff like that gets around fast. And August knew it. It's hard enough being the new kid even when you have a normal face. Imagine having his face?
paras.cn: 我第一天和他坐在一起，因为我同情他。仅此而已。他就在那里，这个在新学校里长相奇怪的孩子。没人和他说话。每个人都在盯着他。我那桌所有的女孩都在小声议论他。他不是比彻预备学校唯一的新生，但他却是唯一一个被大家谈论的人。朱利安给他起了个外号叫“僵尸小子”，大家也都这么叫他。“你看到那个僵尸小子了吗？” 那样的话传得很快。而且奥古斯特知道。即使你有一张正常的脸，当新生也已经够难了。想象一下有他那样的脸？

vocab.ex: I feel sorry for people who have to work on holidays.
She found a strange-looking mushroom in the forest.
The students were whispering about the new teacher.
His friends nicknamed him 'Speedy' because he ran so fast.
News of their engagement got around the office quickly.
Learning a new language is hard enough without having to study for other exams.

gram.name: 祈使句（用于唤起共情）
gram.function: 通过使用一个祈使句式的反问句 'Imagine having his face?'，作者直接向读者发出指令，要求他们进行换位思考。这不仅仅是一个问题，更是一种强有力的修辞手法，旨在打破读者的旁观者心态，迫使他们去体验角色的处境，从而产生深刻的共情。

example.en: Think about how she must have felt.
example.cn: 想一想她当时肯定是什么感受。

gram.constraints: 是一种非常直接和有力的情感引导技巧。

paras.en: So I just went over and sat with him. Not a biggie. I wish people would stop trying to turn it into something major. He's just a kid. The weirdest-looking kid I've ever seen, yes. But just a kid.
paras.cn: 所以我只是走过去和他坐在一起。没什么大不了的。我希望人们别再想把它搞成什么大事了。他只是个孩子。是的，他是我见过的长相最怪的孩子。但只是个孩子。

vocab.ex: I'll go over to her desk and ask her if she needs help.
Don't worry about being a few minutes late; it's not a biggie.
They turned the old warehouse into a modern art gallery.
This is a major decision; you should think about it carefully.
He bought the weirdest-looking lamp at the flea market.

gram.name: 并置手法（用于人性化）
gram.function: 通过将一个极端的、承认外表差异的陈述（'The weirdest-looking kid I've ever seen'）与一个简单、具有普遍性的陈述（'But just a kid'）并置，作者创造了强烈的对比。这种结构承认了物理现实，但最终强调了更深层次的、共同的人性， powerfully reinforcing the chapter's main theme.

example.en: He was the slowest runner on the team, yes. But he had the most heart.
example.cn: 是的，他是队里跑得最慢的。但他最有毅力。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比来强调核心观点的有效修辞技巧。

paras.en: I do admit August's face takes some getting used to. I've been sitting with him for two weeks now, and let's just say he's not the neatest eater in the world. But other than that, he's pretty nice. I should also say that I don't really feel sorry for him anymore. That might have been what made me sit down with him the first time, but it's not why I keep sitting down with him. I keep sitting down with him because he is fun.
paras.cn: 我确实承认奥古斯特的脸需要一些时间来适应。我已经和他坐了两周了，这么说吧，他不是世界上最整洁的食客。但除此之外，他人很好。我也应该说，我真的不再为他感到难过了。那可能是我第一次和他坐下的原因，但那不是我一直和他坐在一起的原因。我一直和他坐在一起是因为他很有趣。

vocab.ex: He finally had to admit that he had made a mistake.
The city's fast pace takes some getting used to if you're from a small town.

vocab.mean: 这么说吧（用于委婉或总结性地陈述）
vocab.ex: Was the movie good? Let's just say I've seen better.
The hotel room was small, but other than that, our stay was perfect.
I feel sorry for people who have to work on holidays.

gram.name: 对比动机（过去与现在）
gram.pattern: That might have been [past reason], but it's not [present reason].
gram.function: 通过一个清晰的对比结构，叙述者区分了她行为的初始动机（同情）和当前动机（乐趣）。这种结构有力地展示了她对奥古斯特看法的转变，从一个外部观察者变成了一个真正的朋友。

example.en: Fear might have been what held me back at first, but it's not why I'm cautious now; I'm cautious because I'm wise.
example.cn: 恐惧可能是我最初退缩的原因，但那不是我现在谨慎的原因；我现在谨慎是因为我明智。

gram.constraints: 是展示个人成长和视角变化的有效句法结构。

paras.en: One of the things I'm not loving about this year is how a lot of the kids are acting like they're too grown-up to play things anymore. All they want to do is "hang out" and "talk" at recess. And all they talk about now is who likes who and who is cute and isn't cute. August doesn't bother about that stuff. He likes to play Four Square at recess, which I love to play, too.
paras.cn: 今年我不太喜欢的一件事是，很多孩子都表现得好像他们太成熟了，不能再玩游戏了。他们在课间休息时只想“闲逛”和“聊天”。而他们现在谈论的都是谁喜欢谁，谁可爱谁不可爱。奥古斯特不为那些事烦恼。他喜欢在课间休息时玩四方格游戏，我也很喜欢玩。

vocab.ex: She tries to act very grown-up around her older cousins.
Do you want to hang out at the mall this weekend?
The children played soccer during recess.
Don't bother about the mess; I'll clean it up later.
Four Square is a popular playground game involving a ball and four squares on the ground.

gram.name: 引号（表示疏离或怀疑）
gram.function: 将一些词（'hang out', 'talk'）放在引号里，可以暗示叙述者对这些行为持有一种疏离、不完全认同甚至轻微鄙夷的态度。它表明叙述者认为这些所谓的“成熟”活动并没有什么实质内容。

example.en: He told me about his "important" meeting, but it sounded like just another coffee break.
example.cn: 他告诉了我他那个“重要的”会议，但这听起来不过是又一次茶歇而已。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过标点来传达叙述者态度的 subtle（微妙的）修辞手法。

paras.en: It was actually because I was playing Four Square with August that I found out about the Plague. Apparently this is a "game" that's been going on since the beginning of the year. Anyone who accidentally touches August has only thirty seconds to wash their hands or find hand sanitizer before they catch the Plague. I'm not sure what happens to you if you actually catch the Plague because nobody's touched August yet—not directly.
paras.cn: 实际上，正是在和奥古斯特玩四方格游戏时，我才发现了“瘟疫”这件事。显然，这是一个从年初就开始的“游戏”。任何不小心碰到奥古斯特的人只有三十秒的时间洗手或找洗手液，否则他们就会染上“瘟疫”。我不确定如果你真的染上“瘟疫”会发生什么，因为还没有人碰过奥古斯特——没有直接碰过。

vocab.ex: I need to find out about the schedule for the conference.

vocab.mean: 瘟疫（此处指一个残酷的游戏）
vocab.ex: The story describes a cruel social game called 'The Plague'.
Apparently, the meeting has been cancelled.
I accidentally broke my mother's favorite vase.
It's a good idea to carry hand sanitizer with you.

gram.name: 强调句型 (It was... that...)
gram.pattern: It was + [emphasized part] + that + [rest of sentence]
gram.function: 用于强调句子中的某个特定部分。'It was actually because I was playing Four Square with August that I found out...' 强调了她发现这件事的具体情境和原因。

example.en: It was during my trip to Italy that I discovered my love for art.
example.cn: 我正是在意大利旅行期间发现了自己对艺术的热爱。

gram.constraints: 几乎可以强调句子中除谓语动词外的任何成分。

paras.en: How I found out about this is that Maya Markowitz told me that the reason she won't play Four Square with us at recess is that she doesn't want to catch the Plague. I was like, "What's the Plague?" And she told me. I told Maya I thought that was really dumb and she agreed, but she still wouldn't touch a ball that August just touched, not if she could help it.
paras.cn: 我发现这件事的方式是，玛雅·马科维茨告诉我，她课间不和我们一起玩四方格游戏的原因是她不想染上“瘟疫”。我当时就说：“什么是瘟疫？” 然后她就告诉了我。我告诉玛雅我觉得那真的很蠢，她也同意，但她仍然不会去碰奥古斯特刚碰过的球，只要她能避免。

vocab.ex: And then he cancelled, and I was like, 'Are you serious?'
That was a dumb mistake to make.

vocab.word: not if one can help it
vocab.ex: I won't go back there, not if I can help it.

gram.name: 条件习语
gram.function: 这是一个固定的习语，用于强烈地表达某人会尽一切努力去避免做某事。'...she still wouldn't touch a ball..., not if she could help it' 强调了玛雅避免接触的决心非常坚定，尽管她口头上也认为这个游戏很“蠢”。

example.en: He avoids public speaking, not if he can help it.
example.cn: 他避免公开发言，只要能避免就绝不开口。

gram.constraints: 通常用于否定句的末尾，以加强语气。

paras.en: I was really excited because I got an invitation to Savanna's Halloween party. Savanna is probably the most popular girl in the school. All the boys like her. All the girls want to be friends with her. She was the first girl in the grade to actually have a "boyfriend." It was some kid who goes to MS 281, though she dumped him and started dating Henry Joplin, which makes sense because the two of them totally look like teenagers already.
paras.cn: 我真的很兴奋，因为我收到了萨凡纳万圣节派对的邀请。萨凡纳可能是学校里最受欢迎的女孩。所有的男孩都喜欢她。所有的女孩都想和她做朋友。她是年级里第一个真正有“男朋友”的女孩。是某个上281中学的小子，不过她把他甩了，开始和亨利·乔普林约会，这很合理，因为他们俩看起来已经完全像青少年了。

vocab.ex: Did you receive the invitation to the wedding?
She is the most popular student in her class.
He was devastated after she dumped him.
His explanation didn't make sense to me.

gram.name: 首语重复法 (All the...)
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase at the beginning of successive clauses.
gram.function: 通过在连续的句子开头重复 'All the...'，作者建立了一种强烈的节奏感，并有力地强调了萨凡纳的“受欢迎”程度是普遍性的，涵盖了男孩和女孩两个群体，迅速地塑造了她的社会地位。

example.en: All the lights were on. All the doors were open. All the food was gone.
example.cn: 所有的灯都亮着。所有的门都开着。所有的食物都没了。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调和列举。

paras.en: Anyway, even though I'm not in the "popular" group, I somehow got invited, which is very cool. When I told Savanna I got her invitation and would be going to her party, she was really nice to me, though she made sure to tell me that she didn't invite a lot of people, so I shouldn't go around bragging to anyone that I got invited. Maya didn't get invited, for instance. Savanna also made sure to tell me not to wear a costume. It's good she told me because, of course, I would have worn a costume to a Halloween party—not the unicorn costume I made for the Halloween Parade, but the Goth girl getup that I'd worn to school. But even that was a no-no for Savanna's party. The only negative about my going to Savanna's party was that now I wouldn't be able to go the parade and the unicorn costume would be wasted. That was kind of a bummer, but okay.
paras.cn: 不管怎样，尽管我不在“受欢迎”的圈子里，我不知怎地被邀请了，这很酷。当我告诉萨凡纳我收到了她的邀请并将去参加她的派对时，她对我非常好，不过她特意告诉我她没邀请很多人，所以我不要到处向任何人吹嘘我被邀请了。比如，玛雅就没被邀请。萨凡纳还特意告诉我不要穿戏服。她告诉我真是太好了，因为，当然，我本来会穿戏服去万圣节派对的——不是我为万圣节游行做的那套独角兽服装，而是我穿去学校的那套哥特女孩装扮。但即便是那套，对萨凡纳的派对来说也是不行的。我去萨凡纳派对唯一的坏处是，现在我就不能去游行了，那套独角兽服装就浪费了。那有点扫兴，但好吧。

vocab.ex: I lost my keys, but somehow I managed to get into the house.
He's always bragging about how much money he makes.
He was wearing a ridiculous cowboy getup.
Wearing white to a wedding is a big no-no.
All his hard work on the project felt wasted when it was cancelled.
It's a bummer that the concert was cancelled.

gram.name: make sure to tell
gram.function: 用于强调某人特意去确保另一人知道某事或做某事。'she made sure to tell me...' 被重复使用，暗示了萨凡纳在控制派对的社交规则方面非常刻意和谨慎，也暗示了叙述者和她的圈子之间的隔阂。

example.en: Before I left, my mom made sure to tell me to call her when I arrived.
example.cn: 我离开前，我妈妈特意嘱咐我到了之后给她打电话。

gram.constraints: 是一种强调意图的常见用法。

paras.en: Anyway, the first thing that happened when I got to her party was that Savanna greeted me at the door and asked: "Where's your boyfriend, Summer?" I didn't even know what she was talking about. "I guess he doesn't have to wear a mask at Halloween, right?" she added. And then I knew she was talking about August. "He's not my boyfriend," I said. "I know. I'm just kidding!" She kissed my cheek (all the girls in her group kissed each other's cheeks now whenever they said hello), and threw my jacket on a coatrack in her hallway. Then she took me by the hand down the stairs to her basement, which is where the party was. I didn't see her parents anywhere.
paras.cn: 不管怎样，我到她派对后发生的第一件事是，萨凡纳在门口迎接我并问道：“你男朋友在哪儿呢，萨默？” 我甚至不知道她在说什么。“我猜他在万圣节不用戴面具，对吧？” 她补充道。然后我就知道她在说奥古斯特了。“他不是我男朋友，” 我说。“我知道。我只是开个玩笑！” 她亲了我的脸颊（她那个圈子的所有女孩现在打招呼时都会亲吻彼此的脸颊），然后把我的夹克扔在她走廊的衣帽架上。接着她牵着我的手下楼到她的地下室，派对就在那里。我没在任何地方看到她的父母。

vocab.ex: He greeted his guests with a warm smile.
"And don't be late," she added as he was leaving.
Don't be so serious, I was only kidding.
Please hang your coat on the coatrack by the door.
They converted their basement into a game room.

gram.name: 附加问句 (..., right?)
gram.function: 一种非常口语化的附加疑问句形式，用于寻求对方的同意或确认。'..., right?' 比标准的附加疑问句（如 '..., does he?'）更非正式、更常用。

example.en: The meeting is at 3 PM, right?
example.cn: 会议是下午三点，对吧？

gram.constraints: 用于非正式对话中。

paras.en: There were about fifteen kids there: all of them were popular kids from either Savanna's group or Julian's group. I guess they've all kind of merged into one big supergroup of popular kids, now that some of them have started dating each other. I didn't even know there were so many couples. I mean, I knew about Savanna and Henry, but Ximena and Miles? And Ellie and Amos? Ellie's practically as flat as I am.
paras.cn: 那里大概有十五个孩子：他们全都是来自萨凡纳圈子或朱利安圈子的受欢迎的孩子。我猜他们现在都合并成一个大的超级受欢迎团体了，既然他们中有些人已经开始互相约会了。我甚至不知道有这么多情侣。我的意思是，我知道萨凡纳和亨利的事，但西梅纳和迈尔斯？还有艾莉和阿莫斯？艾莉的身材几乎和我一样平。

vocab.ex: The two small companies decided to merge into one large corporation.
The band was a supergroup, formed by famous musicians from other bands.
They are a lovely couple and have been married for ten years.
I've been working on this all day; I'm practically finished.
The landscape was completely flat for miles.

gram.name: 反问句（用于表达惊讶）
gram.pattern: A series of questions to express disbelief.
gram.function: 说话者通过提出一系列反问句（'Ximena and Miles? And Ellie and Amos?'）来表达她对新情侣组合的惊讶和难以置信。这些问题并不期望得到回答，而是纯粹的情感表达。

example.en: You're moving to another country? Just like that?
example.cn: 你要搬到另一个国家去？就这么定了？

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的口语化表达方式。

paras.en: Anyway, about five minutes after I got there, Henry and Savanna were standing next to me, literally hovering over me. "So, we want to know why you hang out with the Zombie Kid so much," said Henry. "He's not a zombie," I laughed, like they were making a joke. I was smiling but I didn't feel like smiling.
paras.cn: 不管怎样，我到那里大约五分钟后，亨利和萨凡纳就站在我旁边，简直是在我上方盘旋。“那么，我们想知道你为什么那么常和那个僵尸小子一起玩，” 亨利说。“他不是僵尸，” 我笑了，好像他们在开玩笑一样。我微笑着，但我并不想笑。

vocab.mean: 简直；（用于加强语气的）真的
vocab.ex: It was so hot, I was literally melting.
The helicopter hovered over the building before landing.
The bullies gave the new student the mean nickname 'Zombie Kid'.
I don't feel like cooking tonight; let's order pizza.

gram.name: 行为与感受的对比
gram.pattern: I was [action], but I didn't feel like [action].
gram.function: 通过一个清晰的对比结构，叙述者揭示了她外在行为（'I was smiling'）和内在真实感受（'but I didn't feel like smiling'）之间的巨大鸿沟。这有力地传达了她在社交压力下被迫伪装情绪的无奈和不适。

example.en: I was clapping, but I didn't feel like clapping at all.
example.cn: 我在鼓掌，但我一点也不想鼓掌。

gram.constraints: 是一种展示人物内心挣扎的有效技巧。

paras.en: "You know, Summer," said Savanna, "you would be a lot more popular if you didn't hang out with him so much. I'm going to be completely honest with you: Julian likes you. He wants to ask you out." "He does?" "Do you think he's cute?" "Um . . . yeah, I guess. Yeah, he's cute." "So you have to choose who you want to hang out with," Savanna said. She was talking to me like a big sister would talk to a little sister. "Everyone likes you, Summer. Everyone thinks you're really nice and that you're really, really pretty. You could totally be part of our group if you wanted to, and believe me, there are a lot of girls in our grade who would love that."
paras.cn: “你知道吗，萨默，” 萨凡纳说，“如果你不那么常和他一起玩，你会受欢迎得多。我跟你说实话：朱利安喜欢你。他想约你出去。” “他真的？” “你觉得他可爱吗？” “嗯……是的，我猜是吧。是的，他很可爱。” “所以你必须选择你想和谁一起玩，” 萨凡纳说。她像一个大姐姐对小妹妹说话一样跟我说话。“大家都喜欢你，萨默。大家都觉得你人很好，而且你真的非常非常漂亮。如果你愿意，你完全可以成为我们团体的一份子，而且相信我，我们年级有很多女孩会很乐意那样。”

vocab.ex: You know, I was thinking about what you said yesterday.
She is the most popular student in her class.
He was too shy to ask her out.
She thought the new boy in her class was really cute.
Believe me, you don't want to miss this movie.

gram.name: 第二条件句（用于给建议）
gram.pattern: Subject + would be + comparative + if + past simple.
gram.function: 用于提出一个与现实相反的假设，并说明其可能带来的不同结果，常被用来给出建议或施加压力。'you would be a lot more popular if you didn't hang out with him' 提出了一个假设性选择，以此来劝说萨默改变她的行为。

example.en: You would feel much better if you got more sleep.
example.cn: 如果你多睡一会儿，你会感觉好得多。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的、委婉的建议方式。

paras.en: "I know." I nodded. "Thank you." "You're welcome," she answered. "You want me to tell Julian to come and talk to you?" I looked over to where she was pointing and could see Julian looking over at us. "Um, I actually need to go to the bathroom. Where is that?" I went to where she pointed, sat down on the side of the bathtub, and called Mom and asked her to pick me up.
paras.cn: “我知道。” 我点了点头。“谢谢你。” “不客气，” 她回答。“你想让我告诉朱利安过来和你说话吗？” 我朝她指的方向看去，能看到朱利安正朝我们这边看。“嗯，我其实需要去趟洗手间。洗手间在哪里？” 我去了她指的地方，坐在浴缸边上，给妈妈打电话，让她来接我。

vocab.ex: "Thank you for your help." "You're welcome."
He looked over at the clock to check the time.
She enjoyed a long, relaxing soak in the bathtub.
Can you pick me up from the airport tomorrow?

gram.name: 用借口逃离
gram.pattern: Using a polite excuse to exit an uncomfortable situation.
gram.function: 当面临一个不想回答的问题或不想参与的互动时，角色使用了一个常见的社交借口（“我需要去洗手间”）来暂时逃离这个令人不适的情境。这是一种在叙事中展示人物回避行为的真实手法。

example.en: When they started arguing, I said I had to make an important phone call and left the room.
example.cn: 当他们开始争吵时，我说我得打个重要电话，然后离开了房间。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的社交策略。

paras.en: "Is everything okay?" said Mom. "Yeah, I just don't want to stay," I said. Mom didn't ask any more questions and said she'd be there in ten minutes. "Don't ring the bell," I told her. "Just call me when you're outside." I hung out in the bathroom until Mom called, and then I snuck upstairs without anyone seeing me, got my jacket, and went outside.
paras.cn: “一切都好吗？” 妈妈说。“嗯，我只是不想待了，” 我说。妈妈没有再问任何问题，说她十分钟后到。“别按门铃，” 我告诉她。“你在外面时给我打电话就行。” 我在洗手间待到妈妈打电话来，然后我偷偷溜上楼，没人看见我，拿了我的夹克，然后出去了。

vocab.ex: Please ring the bell when you arrive.
He decided to just hang out at home and watch movies all day.
He tried to sneak into the movie theater without a ticket.

gram.name: 简短直接的愿望陈述
gram.function: 通过一个非常简单、直接的陈述句 'I just don't want to stay'，叙述者没有提供复杂的解释，而是直接表达了她的核心愿望。这种简洁性传达了一种强烈的、不容置疑的情感，使得母亲也无需再问，直接采取了行动。

example.en: Why aren't you eating? - I just don't want to.
example.cn: 你为什么不吃？ - 我就是不想吃。

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中表达坚定决心的有效方式。

paras.en: It was only nine-thirty. The Halloween Parade was in full swing down Amesfort Avenue. Huge crowds everywhere. Everyone was in costume. Skeletons. Pirates. Princesses. Vampires. Superheroes. But not one unicorn.
paras.cn: 才九点半。万圣节游行正在艾姆斯福特大道上如火如荼地进行着。到处都是巨大的人群。每个人都穿着戏服。骷髅。海盗。公主。吸血鬼。超级英雄。但没有一头独角兽。

vocab.ex: By the time we arrived, the party was already in full swing.
A large crowd gathered to watch the parade.
He wore a skeleton costume for Halloween.
The boy dressed up as a pirate, complete with an eyepatch and a sword.
According to legend, vampires cannot be seen in mirrors.
Superman is a classic superhero known for his strength and ability to fly.

gram.name: 结论性的缺失陈述
gram.pattern: A list of presences followed by a statement of absence.
gram.function: 在通过一系列句子片段列举了游行中各种“在场”的角色之后，作者以一个简短而有力的、表示“缺席”的句子 'But not one unicorn' 结尾。这种结构创造了强烈的对比和失落感，不仅点明了叙述者因为去了派对而错过的机会（扮成独角兽），也象征着她在社交压力下所失去的纯真和自我。

example.en: There were cakes, balloons, and presents. But not one friendly face.
example.cn: 有蛋糕，有气球，有礼物。但没有一张友善的面孔。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比来产生强烈情感冲击的文学技巧。

paras.en: The next day at school I told Savanna I had eaten some really bad Halloween candy and gotten sick, which is why I went home early from her party, and she believed me. There was actually a stomach bug going around, so it was a good lie. I also told her that I had a crush on someone else that wasn't Julian so she would leave me alone about that and hopefully spread the word to Julian that I wasn't interested. She, of course, wanted to know who I had a crush on, and I told her it was a secret.
paras.cn: 第二天在学校，我告诉萨凡纳我吃了一些很糟糕的万圣节糖果然后生病了，这就是为什么我从她的派对上早早回家的原因，她相信了我。当时确实有肠胃炎在流行，所以这是个好谎言。我还告诉她我暗恋的是别人而不是朱利安，这样她就不会再烦我这件事，而且希望能把我不感兴趣的消息传给朱利安。当然，她想知道我暗恋谁，我告诉她这是个秘密。

vocab.ex: If you don't wear a coat in the winter, you might get sick.
A lot of students are absent today because a stomach bug is going around the school.
She had a huge crush on the lead singer of the band.
Please leave me alone; I need to concentrate.
The party is cancelled. Can you help spread the word to everyone?

gram.name: so (that) 目的状语从句
gram.function: 用于解释一个动作的目的。'...I had a crush on someone else... so she would leave me alone...' 解释了“说自己有暗恋对象”背后的目的。

example.en: I spoke slowly so everyone could understand me.
example.cn: 我慢慢说，以便每个人都能听懂我。

gram.constraints: 口语中 'that' 常常被省略。

paras.en: August was absent the day after Halloween, and when he came back, I could tell something was up with him. He was acting so weird at lunch! He barely said a word, and kept looking down at his food when I talked to him. Like he wouldn't look me in the eye. Finally, I was like, "Auggie, is everything okay? Are you mad at me or something?"
paras.cn: 万圣节后的第二天奥古斯特缺席了，当他回来时，我看得出他有点不对劲。他午餐时表现得太奇怪了！他几乎一句话都没说，和我说话时一直低头看着他的食物。就好像他不愿意直视我的眼睛。最后，我忍不住说：“奥吉，一切都好吗？你是生我的气了还是怎么了？”

vocab.ex: She was absent from school because she was sick.
He's been quiet all day; I think something is up with him.
His behavior was very weird today.
I could barely hear what he was saying over the loud music.
He couldn't look me in the eye when he told me the lie.
Please don't be mad at me for being late.

gram.name: I was like... (用于引出对话)
gram.function: 在非正式的口语叙事中，'I was like' 是一种非常常见的用法，用来引述某人说过的话或当时的想法，通常表示一种忍不住或最终开口的情绪。它比 'I said' 更具对话感。

example.en: He kept ignoring me, so finally I was like, 'Are you going to answer me or not?'
example.cn: 他一直不理我，所以我最后忍不住说：‘你到底回不回答我？’

gram.constraints: 主要用于非正式口语和模仿口语的写作中。

paras.en: "No," he said. "Sorry you weren't feeling well on Halloween. I kept looking for Boba Fett in the hallways." "Yeah, I was sick." "Did you have that stomach bug?" "Yeah, I guess." He opened a book and started to read, which was kind of rude. "I'm so excited about the Egyptian Museum project," I said. "Aren't you?" He shook his head, his mouth full of food. I actually looked away because between the way he was chewing, which almost seemed like he was being gross on purpose, and the way his eyes were just kind of closed down, I was getting a really bad vibe from him.
paras.cn: “不，” 他说。“真遗憾你万圣节那天不舒服。我一直在走廊里找波巴·费特。” “是啊，我病了。” “你得了那个肠胃炎吗？” “嗯，我猜是吧。” 他打开一本书开始读，这有点无礼。“我对埃及博物馆项目感到非常兴奋，” 我说。“你不兴奋吗？” 他摇了摇头，嘴里塞满了食物。我真的移开了目光，因为介于他咀嚼的方式——几乎像是故意表现得很恶心——和他眼睛就那样半闭着的样子之间，我从他身上感觉到一种非常糟糕的氛围。

vocab.ex: It's rude to talk with your mouth full.
When asked if he wanted more food, he shook his head.
Don't chew with your mouth open; it's gross.
I'm sorry, I didn't break it on purpose.

vocab.mean: （非正式）不好的氛围；不祥的感觉
vocab.ex: I got a really bad vibe from that empty house.

gram.name: Between X and Y (用于列举原因)
gram.function: 用于引出导致某个结果的两个或多个并列的原因或观察。'...between the way he was chewing... and the way his eyes were... , I was getting a really bad vibe...' 清晰地表明了是两个因素的结合导致了叙述者的负面感受。

example.en: Between the long hours and the low pay, he decided to quit his job.
example.cn: 介于长时间工作和低薪之间，他决定辞职。

gram.constraints: 是一种说明多重原因的有效结构。

paras.en: "What project did you get?" I asked. He shrugged, pulled out a little scrap of paper from his jeans pocket, and flicked it across the table to me. Everyone in the grade got assigned an Egyptian artifact to work on for Egyptian Museum Day, which was in December. The teachers wrote all the assignments down on tiny scraps of paper, which they put into a fishbowl, and then all us kids in the grade took turns picking the papers out of the fishbowl in assembly.
paras.cn: “你拿到了什么项目？” 我问。他耸了耸肩，从牛仔裤口袋里掏出一小片废纸，把它弹到桌子对面给我。年级里的每个学生都被分配了一个埃及手工艺品，为十二月的埃及博物馆日做准备。老师们把所有的任务都写在小纸片上，然后把它们放进一个鱼缸里，接着我们年级所有的孩子在集会时轮流从鱼缸里抽纸片。

vocab.ex: When I asked him where the money was, he just shrugged.
He wrote the phone number on a scrap of paper.
She flicked a crumb off the table with her finger.

vocab.mean: （有历史文化价值的）手工艺品
vocab.ex: The museum has a large collection of ancient Egyptian artifacts.
We used a fishbowl to draw names for the raffle.
The principal made an important announcement at the morning assembly.

gram.name: 并列动词短语
gram.function: 用于描述一个主语连续进行的多个动作，使叙事简洁流畅。'He shrugged, pulled out..., and flicked it...' 描绘了奥古斯特一连串冷漠的动作。

example.en: She stood up, walked to the window, and looked outside.
example.cn: 她站起来，走到窗边，向外望去。

gram.constraints: 所有并列的动词时态应保持一致。

paras.en: So I unfolded Auggie's little slip of paper. "Oh, cool!" I said, maybe a little overexcited because I was trying to get him psyched up. "You got the Step Pyramid of Sakkara!" "I know!" he said. "I got Anubis, the god of the afterlife." "The one with the dog head?" "It's actually a jackal head," I corrected him. "Hey, you want to start working on our projects together after school? You could come over to my house."
paras.cn: 于是我展开了奥吉的小纸条。“哦，酷！” 我说，也许有点过于兴奋，因为我正试图让他振作起来。“你拿到了萨卡拉的阶梯金字塔！” “我知道！” 他说。“我拿到的是阿努比斯，来世之神。” “就是那个狗头的？” “其实是胡狼头，” 我纠正他。“嘿，你想放学后一起做我们的项目吗？你可以来我家。”

vocab.ex: He carefully unfolded the old map.
She wrote her phone number on a small slip of paper.
The children were getting overexcited before the party started.

vocab.mean: 让某人振作起来；使某人兴奋
vocab.ex: The coach gave a speech to get the team psyched up before the big game.
Ancient Egyptians had complex beliefs about the afterlife.
The god Anubis is often depicted with the head of a jackal.
Why don't you come over for dinner on Friday?

gram.name: 同位语短语
gram.function: 用于对前面的名词进行补充说明或解释。'...Anubis, the god of the afterlife' 中的 'the god of the afterlife' 就是对 'Anubis' 的解释说明。

example.en: I'm reading a book by Jane Austen, the famous English novelist.
example.cn: 我正在读著名英国小说家简·奥斯汀写的一本书。

gram.constraints: 同位语与它所修饰的词在逻辑上指的是同一事物。

paras.en: He put his sandwich down and leaned back in his chair. I can't even describe the look he was giving me. "You know, Summer," he said. "You don't have to do this." "What are you talking about?" "You don't have to be friends with me. I know Mr. Tushman talked to you." "I have no idea what you're talking about." "You don't have to pretend, is all I'm saying. I know Mr. Tushman talked to some kids before school started and told them they had to be friends with me."
paras.cn: 他放下三明治，向后靠在椅子上。我甚至无法形容他看我的那种眼神。“你知道吗，萨默，” 他说。“你不必这么做。” “你在说什么？” “你不必和我做朋友。我知道塔什曼先生找你谈过了。” “我完全不知道你在说什么。” “我只是说你不必假装。我知道塔什曼先生在开学前和一些孩子谈过，告诉他们必须和我做朋友。”

vocab.ex: He leaned back in his chair and relaxed.
From the look he gave me, I knew he was angry.
The children pretended to be asleep when their mom came in.
I'm not criticizing you; that it's a risky plan is all I'm saying.

gram.name: 重复以示强调 (You don't have to...)
gram.function: 奥吉通过重复 'You don't have to...' 这个短语，有力地表达了他内心的核心想法：他认为萨默和他做朋友并非出于自愿，而是一种被迫的责任。这种重复突显了他的不安全感和被背叛后的多疑。

example.en: "I don't want to go. I don't want to see them. I don't want to talk about it," she said firmly.
example.cn: “我不想去。我不想见他们。我不想谈论这件事，” 她坚决地说。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过重复来强调情感和观点的有效手法。

paras.en: "He did not talk to me, August." "Yeah, he did." "No, he did not." "Yeah, he did." "No he didn't!! I swear on my life!" I put my hands up in the air so he could see I wasn't crossing my fingers. He immediately looked down at my feet, so I shook off my UGGs so he could see my toes weren't crossed. "You're wearing tights," he said accusingly. "You can see my toes are flat!" I yelled.
paras.cn: “他没找我谈，奥古斯特。” “是，他谈了。” “不，他没有。” “是，他谈了。” “不他没有！！我以我的生命发誓！” 我把手举到空中，好让他看到我没有交叉手指。他立刻低头看我的脚，所以我脱掉了我的UGG雪地靴，好让他看到我的脚趾也没有交叉。“你穿着连裤袜，” 他指责地说。“你可以看到我的脚趾是平的！” 我喊道。

vocab.ex: I swear on my life, I am telling you the truth.

vocab.mean: 交叉手指（表示希望好运，或暗中表示撒谎）
vocab.ex: He promised to help, but I saw him crossing his fingers behind his back.
He came inside and shook the snow off his coat.
She wore a pair of black tights under her skirt.
She looked at him accusingly after he broke the vase.

gram.name: 短句轮替对话（Stichomythia）
gram.pattern: A series of short, alternating lines of dialogue.
gram.function: 通过使用一系列极短的、针锋相对的单行对话（'Yeah, he did.' 'No, he did not.'），作者创造了一种快速、紧张的节奏，生动地表现了两个角色之间的对峙和冲突，增强了对话的戏剧张力。

example.en: A: You knew. B: I did not. A: You're lying! B: I'm not!
example.cn: A：你知道的。B：我不知道。A：你在撒谎！B：我没有！

gram.constraints: 是一种戏剧性的对话技巧，用于表现冲突。

paras.en: "Okay, you don't have to scream." "I don't like being accused of things, okay?" "Okay. I'm sorry." "You should be." "He really didn't talk to you?" "Auggie!" "Okay, okay, I'm really sorry." I would have stayed mad at him longer, but then he told me about something bad that had happened to him on Halloween and I couldn't stay mad at him anymore. Basically, he heard Jack bad-mouthing him and saying really horrible things behind his back. It kind of explained his attitude, and now I knew why he'd been out "sick."
paras.cn: “好了，你不必尖叫。” “我不喜欢被指控，好吗？” “好的。对不起。” “你本该道歉的。” “他真的没和你谈过？” “奥吉！” “好了，好了，我真的很抱歉。” 我本可以对他生更久的气，但接着他告诉了我万圣节发生在他身上的一件坏事，我就再也无法对他生气了。基本上，他听到杰克在背后说他坏话，说了一些非常可怕的话。这在某种程度上解释了他的态度，现在我知道他为什么“病”了。

vocab.ex: He was accused of stealing the money.

vocab.mean: 你本该如此（用于回应道歉，表示对方确实该道歉）
vocab.ex: A: I'm sorry for being so rude. B: You should be.
I can't stay mad at you when you look so sorry.
It's not nice to bad-mouth your friends behind their backs.
I hate it when people talk about me behind my back.
He has a very positive attitude towards life.

gram.name: 混合条件句（未实现的过去）
gram.pattern: would have + pp..., but + simple past.
gram.function: 用于描述一个在过去本可能发生但被另一个真实事件改变了的情况。'I would have stayed mad..., but then he told me...' 清晰地展示了一个未实现的过去可能性（一直生气）和改变它的真实事件（他告诉了我原因）。

example.en: I would have left, but then you called and changed my mind.
example.cn: 我本打算离开了，但接着你打来电话改变了我的主意。

gram.constraints: 是一种连接虚拟过去和真实过去的有效结构。

paras.en: "Promise you won't tell anyone," he said. "I won't." I nodded. "Promise you won't ever be mean like that to me again?" "Promise," he said, and we pinky swore.
paras.cn: “保证你不会告诉任何人，” 他说。“我不会的。” 我点了点头。“保证你再也不会那样刻薄地对我了？” “保证，” 他说，然后我们拉了勾。

vocab.ex: He promised to call me as soon as he arrived.
It was mean of him to say such hurtful things.
The two children made a pinky swear to keep their secret.

gram.name: 和解对话
gram.pattern: A series of promises and agreements.
gram.function: 通过一系列简短的、以“保证”为核心的请求和回应，作者描绘了一个和解的过程。对话从一个秘密的分享开始，到一个相互承诺的缔结结束，象征着误解的消除和友谊的加深。'pinky swore' 这一具体行动，为这个情感时刻提供了一个有力的、充满童真的视觉收尾。

example.en: A: I'm sorry. B: I forgive you. A: Friends again? B: Friends again.
example.cn: A：对不起。B：我原谅你。A：还是朋友吗？B：还是朋友。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对话来展示关系修复的常见叙事技巧。

title: Warning: This Kid Is Rated R

paras.en: I had warned Mom about August's face. I had described what he looked like. I did this because I know she's not always so good at faking her feelings, and August was coming over for the first time today. I even sent her a text at work to remind her about it. But I could tell from the expression on her face when she came home after work that I hadn't prepared her enough. She was shocked when she came through the door and saw his face for the first time.
paras.cn: 我曾警告过妈妈关于奥古斯特的脸。我描述过他长什么样。我这么做是因为我知道她不总是那么擅长伪装自己的感情，而且奥古斯特今天第一次要来我们家。我甚至在她在工作时给她发了条短信提醒她这件事。但我能从她下班回家时的面部表情看出，我没能让她做好充分的准备。当她穿过门第一次看到他的脸时，她惊呆了。

vocab.ex: My parents warned me about talking to strangers.
Can you describe the person you saw?
He's good at faking his feelings, so you never know if he's truly happy or sad.
Why don't you come over for dinner on Friday?
The coach tried to prepare the team for the difficult match.
We were all shocked to hear the news about the accident.

gram.name: 过去完成时（用于表示先于过去的动作）
gram.function: 表示在过去某个时间点或动作之前已经完成的动作。'I had warned Mom...' 和 'I hadn't prepared her enough' 都发生在妈妈“回家看到奥古斯特”这个过去的动作之前，清晰地交代了事件的前因后果。

example.en: By the time I arrived, he had already left.
example.cn: 等我到的时候，他已经走了。

gram.constraints: 是叙述过去事件先后顺序的关键时态。

paras.en: "Hi, Mom, this is Auggie. Can he stay for dinner?" I asked quickly. It took a second for my question to even register. "Hi, Auggie," she said. "Um, of course, sweetheart. If it's okay with Auggie's mother." While Auggie called his mother on his cell phone, I whispered to Mom: "Stop making that weirded-out face!" She had that look like when she's watching the news and some horrific event has happened. She nodded quickly, like she hadn't realized she was making a face, and was really nice and normal to Auggie afterward.
paras.cn: “嗨，妈妈，这是奥吉。他能留下来吃晚饭吗？” 我迅速问道。我的问题过了一秒钟才被她接收到。“嗨，奥吉，” 她说。“嗯，当然可以，宝贝。如果奥吉的妈妈同意的话。” 当奥吉用手机给他妈妈打电话时，我对我妈妈低声说：“别再做那种被吓到的怪表情了！” 她当时的表情就像在看新闻，发生了什么可怕事件一样。她迅速点了点头，好像没意识到自己在做鬼脸，之后对奥吉就非常友善和正常了。

vocab.ex: He said my name, but it took a moment for it to register that he was talking to me.
Come here, sweetheart, and let me give you a hug.

vocab.mean: （非正式）被吓到的；感觉怪异的
vocab.ex: He was totally weirded-out by the strange noises coming from the attic.
The city was devastated by a horrific earthquake.
Let's go to the movies first and get dinner afterward.

gram.name: 反应的比喻
gram.pattern: Noun + had that look like + clause.
gram.function: 通过一个生动的比喻 'She had that look like when she's watching the news...'，作者将一个难以描述的面部表情与一个读者熟悉的、能引起共鸣的情境联系起来，从而清晰地传达了母亲当时震惊和不安的神情。

example.en: He had that look on his face like he had just won the lottery.
example.cn: 他脸上的表情就像他刚中了彩票一样。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过类比来生动描绘人物反应的有效技巧。

paras.en: After a while, Auggie and I got tired of working on our projects and went to hang out in the living room. Auggie was looking at the pictures on the mantel, and he saw a picture of me and Daddy. "Is that your dad?" he said. "Yeah." "I didn't know you were . . . what's the word?" "Biracial." "Right! That's the word." "Yeah." He looked at the picture again. "Are your parents divorced? I've never seen him at drop-off or anything." "Oh, no," I said. "He was a platoon sergeant. He died a few years ago."
paras.cn: 过了一会儿，奥吉和我都对做项目感到厌烦了，就去客厅玩。奥吉正看着壁炉架上的照片，他看到了一张我和爸爸的照片。“那是你爸爸吗？” 他说。“是啊。” “我不知道你是……那个词怎么说来着？” “混血儿。” “对！就是这个词。” “是的。” 他又看了看那张照片。“你父母离婚了吗？我从没在送你上学之类的场合见过他。” “哦，不，” 我说。“他曾是一名排长。他几年前去世了。”

vocab.ex: We decided to just hang out at my house and watch movies.
The family photos were displayed on the mantel above the fireplace.
As a biracial child, she grew up embracing two different cultures.
His parents are divorced, and he lives with his mother.
School drop-off is always chaotic in the morning.
The platoon sergeant was responsible for the training and discipline of his soldiers.

gram.name: 提问以回忆词语
gram.function: 在对话中，当说话者想不起一个词时，会用 'what's the word?' 来向对方求助或给自己时间思考。这是一种非常自然的、模仿真实对话中停顿和思考的方式。

example.en: This food is so... what's the word?... delicious!
example.cn: 这食物太……那个词怎么说来着？……太美味了！

gram.constraints: 是一种使对话更具真实感的技巧。

paras.en: "Whoa! I didn't know that." "Yeah." I nodded, handing him a picture of my dad in his uniform. "Wow, look at all those medals." "Yeah. He was pretty awesome." "Wow, Summer. I'm sorry." "Yeah, it sucks. I really miss him a lot." "Yeah, wow." He nodded, handing me back the picture.
paras.cn: “哇！我不知道那个。” “是啊。” 我点了点头，递给他一张我爸爸穿着制服的照片。“哇，看那些奖章。” “是啊。他很了不起。” “哇，萨默。我很抱歉。” “是啊，这很糟。我真的很想他。” “是啊，哇。” 他点点头，把照片递还给我。

vocab.ex: Whoa, look at the size of that dog!
The soldier looked proud in his dress uniform.
He won a gold medal in the Olympics.
My dad is awesome; he can fix anything.
I can't believe I have to work this weekend. It sucks.

gram.name: 共情与情感共享的对话
gram.pattern: A series of short, simple, and repetitive exchanges.
gram.function: 通过使用一系列非常简短、简单的词语和感叹词（'Whoa!', 'Wow', 'Yeah'），作者描绘了一段充满真诚情感的对话。对话的简洁性并没有削弱其力量，反而突显了奥吉的真诚惊讶、同情和萨默的坦率悲伤。这种对话方式反映了孩子们之间直接、不加修饰的情感交流。

example.en: A: My dog died. B: Oh, wow. I'm so sorry. A: Yeah. It's hard. B: Yeah.
example.cn: A：我的狗死了。B：哦，天。我太遗憾了。A：是啊。很难过。B：是啊。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过简约来传达深厚情感的技巧。

paras.en: "Have you ever known anyone who died?" I asked. He shrugged. "Not really. I mean, I guess they go to heaven? That's where my Grans went." "I think about it a lot," I said. "I think when people die, their souls go to heaven but just for a little while. Like that's where they see their old friends and stuff, and kind of catch up on old times. But then I actually think the souls start thinking about their lives on earth, like if they were good or bad or whatever. And then they get born again as brand-new babies in the world." "Why would they want to do that?" "Because then they get another chance to get it right," I answered. "Their souls get a chance to have a do-over."
paras.cn: “你认识过去世的人吗？” 我问。他耸了耸肩。“不算有。我的意思是，我猜他们去天堂了？我奶奶就是去了那里。” “我经常想这件事，” 我说。“我认为当人们死后，他们的灵魂会去天堂，但只待一小会儿。就像在那里他们会见到老朋友之类的，然后叙叙旧。但接着我其实认为灵魂会开始思考他们在地球上的生活，比如他们是好是坏之类的。然后他们会作为全新的婴儿在世界上重生。” “他们为什么会想那样做？” “因为那样他们就有了另一次把它做对的机会，” 我回答。“他们的灵魂有了一次重来的机会。”

vocab.ex: When I asked him where the money was, he just shrugged.
Many religions have a concept of heaven as a place of eternal happiness.
We should get coffee soon and catch up on old times.
He likes action movies, sci-fi, or whatever.
He bought a brand-new car.
It took several tries, but he finally managed to get it right.
He messed up his speech, so he asked for a do-over.

gram.name: 阐释哲学观
gram.pattern: A series of 'I think...' statements to build a personal belief system.
gram.function: 通过重复使用 'I think...' 并用 'Like...', 'But then...', 'And then...' 等连接词来组织思路，叙述者构建并解释了她自己关于死亡和重生的个人哲学。这种结构模仿了真实的思考和阐述过程，使一个复杂的想法显得循序渐进且易于理解。

example.en: I think we're all connected. Like, our actions affect everyone else. So I think we should always try to be kind.
example.cn: 我认为我们都是相互联系的。比如，我们的行为会影响其他所有人。所以我认为我们应该总是努力保持善良。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过语言来构建个人世界观的有效方式。

paras.en: He thought about what I was saying and then nodded. "Kind of like when you get a makeup test," he said. "Right." "But they don't come back looking the same," he said. "I mean, they look completely different when they come back, right?" "Oh yeah," I answered. "Your soul stays the same but everything else is different." "I like that," he said, nodding a lot. "I really like that, Summer. That means in my next life I won't be stuck with this face."
paras.cn: 他想了想我在说的话，然后点了点头。“有点像你得到一次补考机会，” 他说。“对。” “但他们回来时不会长得一样，” 他说。“我的意思是，他们回来时看起来完全不同，对吧？” “哦是的，” 我回答。“你的灵魂保持不变，但其他一切都不同了。” “我喜欢这个，” 他说，不停地点头。“我真的很喜欢这个，萨默。那意味着我下辈子就不会被困在这张脸里了。”

vocab.ex: If you miss the exam, you will have to take a makeup test.
Some people believe the soul is immortal.
I missed the last bus, so I was stuck with walking home in the rain.

gram.name: 连接抽象与具体
gram.pattern: Connecting a philosophical idea to a relatable, everyday experience.
gram.function: 奥吉通过将萨默提出的关于“灵魂重来一次”（'a do-over'）的抽象哲学概念与一个非常具体的、学生能够理解的日常经验（'a makeup test'）联系起来，展示了他的理解和认同。这种从抽象到具体的连接，使得整个对话更加真实和富有洞察力。

example.en: You say life is unpredictable? It's like trying to catch a slippery fish with your bare hands.
example.cn: 你说生活不可预测？那就像用空手去抓一条滑溜溜的鱼。

gram.constraints: 是解释和理解抽象概念的有效方法。

paras.en: He pointed to his face when he said that and batted his eyes, which made me laugh. "I guess not." I shrugged. "Hey, I might even be handsome!" he said, smiling. "That would be so awesome, wouldn't it? I could come back and be this good-looking dude and be super buff and super tall." I laughed again. He was such a good sport about himself. That's one of the things I like the most about Auggie.
paras.cn: 他说那话时指了指自己的脸，还眨了眨眼，这让我笑了。“我猜不会了。” 我耸了耸肩。“嘿，我甚至可能会很帅呢！” 他笑着说。“那会超赞的，不是吗？我可以回来变成一个好看的家伙，超级强壮，超级高。” 我又笑了。他对自己真是很有风度。那是我最喜欢奥吉的一点。

vocab.mean: 眨眼（常为调情或开玩笑）
vocab.ex: She batted her eyes at the waiter to get his attention.
He grew up to be a very handsome young man.
He's a pretty cool dude.
He spends hours at the gym and is really buff.

vocab.mean: 有风度的人（尤指在输掉或被开玩笑时）
vocab.ex: Even though he lost the game, he was a good sport and congratulated the winner.

gram.name: 附加疑问句
gram.function: 附加在陈述句后，用于寻求对方的同意或确认。'That would be so awesome, wouldn't it?' 是奥吉在分享他的幻想时，寻求萨默的认同。

example.en: It's a beautiful day, isn't it?
example.cn: 今天天气真好，不是吗？

gram.constraints: 通常遵循“前肯后否，前否后肯”的原则。

paras.en: "Hey, Auggie, can I ask you a question?" "Yeah," he said, like he knew exactly what I wanted to ask. I hesitated. I've been wanting to ask him this for a while but I've always lost the guts to ask. "What?" he said. "You want to know what's wrong with my face?" "Yeah, I guess. If it's okay for me to ask." He shrugged. I was so relieved that he didn't seem mad or sad.
paras.cn: “嘿，奥吉，我能问你个问题吗？” “可以，” 他说，好像他确切地知道我想问什么。我犹豫了。我想问他这个已经有一段时间了，但我总是没胆量问。“什么？” 他说。“你想知道我的脸有什么问题吗？” “嗯，我猜是吧。如果我问这个没关系的话。” 他耸了耸肩。我如此宽慰，因为他似乎没有生气或难过。

vocab.ex: She didn't hesitate to help the person in need.
I've been waiting for a while, but he still hasn't arrived.
I wanted to ask her out, but I lost the guts at the last second.
What's wrong with the car? It won't start.

vocab.mean: 松了一口气的；感到宽慰的
vocab.ex: I was so relieved to hear that you were safe.

gram.name: 预见性提问
gram.pattern: Answering a question before it is asked.
gram.function: 奥吉通过直接说出萨默想问但又犹豫着不敢问的问题（'You want to know what's wrong with my face?'），展现了他非凡的洞察力和情商。这种“抢答”不仅打破了尴尬，也表明他对自己被问及此类问题已经习以为常，并主动掌控了对话的走向。

example.en: Before I could ask, he said, 'You want to know why I'm late, don't you?'
example.cn: 在我能开口问之前，他就说：‘你想知道我为什么迟到，对吧？’

gram.constraints: 是一种展示人物洞察力和社交智慧的有效技巧。

paras.en: "Yeah, it's no big deal," he said casually. "The main thing I have is this thing called man-di-bu-lo-facial dys-os-tosis— which took me forever to learn how to pronounce, by the way. But I also have this other syndrome thing that I can't even pronounce. And these things kind of just morphed together into one big superthing, which is so rare they don't even have a name for it. I mean, I don't want to brag or anything, but I'm actually considered something of a medical wonder, you know."
paras.cn: “是啊，没什么大不了的，” 他随口说。“我主要得的是一种叫做‘下-颌-面-骨-发育-不-全’的病——顺便说一下，我花了永远才学会怎么发音。但我还有另一种我甚至都发不出音的综合征。这些东西就这么融合在了一起，变成一个大的超级病症，它太罕见了，以至于他们甚至都还没有名字。我的意思是，我不是想吹牛什么的，但实际上我被认为算是一个医学奇迹，你知道的。”

vocab.ex: Don't worry about breaking the glass; it's no big deal.
He casually mentioned that he was moving to another country.
This homework is going to take forever to finish.
How do you pronounce this word?
The two small clouds seemed to morph together into one large cloud.
He's always bragging about how much money he makes.
His full recovery after the accident was considered a medical wonder.

gram.name: 自嘲式幽默
gram.pattern: Making a joke at one's own expense.
gram.function: 通过在解释自己严重的病情后，用一种看似自夸的语气说自己是“医学奇迹”，并立即澄清这是个玩笑，奥吉使用了一种高级的幽默技巧——自嘲。这不仅展示了他的智慧和坚强，也有效地化解了话题的沉重感，让对话变得轻松，并拉近了与听者的距离。

example.en: I'm not saying I'm a hero or anything, but I did manage to open that jar of pickles.
example.cn: 我不是说我是英雄什么的，但我确实成功拧开了那罐泡菜。

gram.constraints: 是一种展现情商和韧性的有效沟通方式。

paras.en: He smiled. "That was a joke," he said. "You can laugh." I smiled and shook my head. "You're funny, Auggie." I said. "Yes, I am," he said proudly. "I am cool beans."
paras.cn: 他笑了。“那是个玩笑，” 他说。“你可以笑的。” 我笑了笑，摇了摇头。“你真有趣，奥吉。” 我说。“是的，我是，” 他骄傲地说。“我酷毙了。”

vocab.ex: Don't take it seriously; it was just a joke.
After winning the race, he proudly held up his trophy.
You're coming to the party? Cool beans!

gram.name: 自我价值肯定
gram.function: 在一段充满自嘲和对自身困境的坦诚描述之后，以两个非常肯定、直接的陈述句 'Yes, I am' 和 'I am cool beans' 结尾，有力地展示了主角对自己内在价值的认同。尽管他无法改变外表，但他对自己有趣、“酷”的内在特质充满了自信。

example.en: A: You're very brave. B: Yes, I am.
example.cn: A：你很勇敢。B：是的，我是。

gram.constraints: 是一种表达自信和自我认同的有力方式。

paras.en: Over the next month, August and I hung out a lot after school, either at his house or my house. August's parents even invited Mom and me over for dinner a couple of times. I overheard them talking about fixing Mom up on a blind date with August's uncle Ben. On the day of the Egyptian Museum exhibit, we were all really excited and kind of giddy. It had snowed the day before—not as much as it had snowed over the Thanksgiving break, but still, snow is snow.
paras.cn: 接下来的一个月里，奥古斯特和我在放学后经常一起玩，有时在他家，有时在我家。奥古斯特的父母甚至邀请过我和妈妈去吃过几次晚饭。我无意中听到他们在谈论给我妈妈安排一次和奥古斯特的本叔叔的相亲。在埃及博物馆展览的那天，我们都非常兴奋，有点飘飘然。前一天刚下过雪——虽然没有感恩节假期那场雪大，但毕竟，雪就是雪。

vocab.ex: Do you want to hang out at the mall this weekend?
I couldn't help but overhear their conversation.

vocab.word: fix someone up on a blind date
vocab.ph: /fɪks ˈsʌmwʌn ʌp ɒn ə blaɪnd deɪt/
vocab.ex: Her friends tried to fix her up on a blind date, but she wasn't interested.
The art museum has a new exhibit of modern sculptures.
She felt giddy with excitement after winning the lottery.

gram.name: 同义反复（用于强调）
gram.function: 通过重复同一个词来构成一个看似没有信息量的句子（如 'snow is snow'），说话者实际上是在强调该事物的本质属性或其带来的普遍感受。在这里，它传达的意思是“不管雪大雪小，雪本身就是一件令人兴奋的事”。

example.en: A promise is a promise, and you need to keep it.
example.cn: 承诺就是承诺，你必须遵守。

gram.constraints: 是一种依赖上下文来理解其强调含义的修辞手法。

paras.en: The gym was turned into a giant museum, with everyone's Egyptian artifact displayed on a table with a little caption card explaining what the thing was. Most of the artifacts were really great, but I have to say I really think mine and August's were the best. My sculpture of Anubis looked pretty real, and I had even used real gold paint on it. And August had made his step pyramid out of sugar cubes. It was two feet high and two feet long, and he had spray painted the cubes with this kind of fake-sand paint or something. It looked so awesome.
paras.cn: 体育馆变成了一个巨大的博物馆，每个人的埃及手工艺品都陈列在一张桌子上，旁边还有一张小小的说明卡，解释那是什么东西。大多数手工艺品都非常棒，但我得说，我真的觉得我和奥古斯特的是最棒的。我的阿努比斯雕塑看起来相当逼真，我甚至还在上面用了真的金色油漆。而奥古斯特用方糖做出了他的阶梯金字塔。它有两英尺高，两英尺长，他还用一种像假沙子的喷漆之类的东西给方糖上了色。它看起来太棒了。

vocab.ex: The caterpillar will eventually turn into a beautiful butterfly.

vocab.mean: （有历史文化价值的）手工艺品
vocab.ex: The museum has a large collection of ancient Egyptian artifacts.
Each painting in the gallery had a small caption card next to it.
The park is famous for its modern metal sculptures.
She put two sugar cubes in her coffee.
He decided to spray paint his old bike to make it look new.

gram.name: I have to say (作为缓和语)
gram.function: 用作插入语，在表达一个强烈的、可能听起来有些自夸的个人观点之前，起到一种缓和语气的作用。它将一个客观的陈述（“我们的是最好的”）转化为主观的个人感受（“我得说，我认为我们的是最好的”），使语气听起来更谦逊。

example.en: I have to say, this is the best pizza I've ever eaten.
example.cn: 我得说，这是我吃过的最好吃的披萨。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的口语策略。

paras.en: We all dressed up in Egyptian costumes. Some of the kids were Indiana Jones-type archaeologists. Some of them dressed up like pharaohs. August and I dressed up like mummies. Our faces were covered except for two little holes for the eyes and one little hole for the mouth.
paras.cn: 我们都穿上了埃及服装。有些孩子扮成了印第安纳·琼斯式的考古学家。有些孩子扮成了法老。奥古斯特和我扮成了木乃伊。我们的脸都被遮住了，除了眼睛的两个小洞和嘴巴的一个小洞。

vocab.ex: She loves to dress up in her mother's old clothes.
The archaeologist discovered an ancient tomb.
The ancient Egyptian pharaohs were buried in magnificent tombs.
The museum exhibit featured an ancient Egyptian mummy.
The room was empty except for a single chair in the corner.

gram.name: 使用 'Some of them' 的平行结构
gram.pattern: Some of them [description A]. Some of them [description B].
gram.function: 通过重复 'Some of them...' 结构，作者清晰地列举了不同孩子所选择的不同类型的装扮，创造了一种清单式的、有秩序的描述。

example.en: The dogs were all different. Some of them were big. Some of them were small.
example.cn: 那些狗都各不相同。有些是大的。有些是小的。

gram.constraints: 是一种清晰的列举和分类方式。

paras.en: When the parents showed up, they all lined up in the hallway in front of the gym. Then we were told we could go get our parents, and each kid got to take his or her parent on a flashlight tour through the dark gym. August and I took our moms around together. We stopped at each exhibit, explaining what it was, talking in whispers, answering questions. Since it was dark, we used our flashlights to illuminate the artifacts while we were talking. Sometimes, for dramatic effect, we would hold the flashlights under our chins while we were explaining something in detail. It was so much fun, hearing all these whispers in the dark, seeing all the lights zigzagging around the dark room.
paras.cn: 当家长们出现时，他们都在体育馆前的走廊里排队。然后我们被告知可以去接自己的父母了，每个孩子都可以带着他或她的父母在黑暗的体育馆里进行一次手电筒之旅。奥古斯特和我一起带着我们的妈妈们参观。我们在每个展品前停下，解释它是什么，小声地交谈，回答问题。因为天黑，我们说话时就用手电筒照亮手工艺品。有时候，为了戏剧效果，我们在详细解释某件事时会把手电筒举在下巴下面。那太有趣了，在黑暗中听到所有这些悄悄话，看到所有的光在黑暗的房间里曲折地移动。

vocab.ex: He promised to come, but he never showed up.
Please line up in front of the door.
The museum offered a special nighttime flashlight tour.
The moonlight was enough to illuminate the path.
The actor paused for dramatic effect before delivering his final line.
The rabbit began to zigzag across the field to escape the fox.

gram.name: 并列动名词短语（用于感官体验）
gram.function: 用于描述构成某种体验（'fun'）的具体感官元素。通过并列 'hearing...' 和 'seeing...' 这两个动名词短语，作者将抽象的“有趣”感受分解为具体的听觉和视觉画面，使读者的体验更加身临其境。

example.en: The best part of camping is sitting by the fire, listening to the crickets, and watching the stars.
example.cn: 露营最棒的部分就是坐在火边，听着蟋蟀的叫声，看着星星。

gram.constraints: 是一种生动的、调动感官的描述手法。

paras.en: At one point, I went over to get a drink at the water fountain. I had to take the mummy wrap off my face. "Hey, Summer," said Jack, who came over to talk to me. He was dressed like the man from The Mummy. "Cool costume." "Thanks." "Is the other mummy August?" "Yeah." "Um . . . hey, do you know why August is mad at me?" "Uh-huh." I nodded. "Can you tell me?" "No." He nodded. He seemed bummed.
paras.cn: 在某个时刻，我走到饮水机旁喝水。我不得不把脸上的木乃伊裹布取下来。“嘿，萨默，” 杰克说，他走过来和我说话。他打扮得像《木乃伊》里的那个人。“很酷的服装。” “谢谢。” “另一个木乃伊是奥古斯特吗？” “是啊。” “嗯……嘿，你知道奥古斯特为什么生我的气吗？” “嗯哼。” 我点了点头。“你能告诉我吗？” “不能。” 他点了点头。他看起来很沮丧。

vocab.ex: At one point during the movie, almost everyone was crying.
He stopped at the water fountain to get a quick drink.
His costume was made of old bedsheets torn into mummy wraps.
Please don't be mad at me for being late.
"Are you listening?" she asked. "Uh-huh," he replied.
He was really bummed when he found out the concert was cancelled.

gram.name: 断奏式对话
gram.pattern: A series of very short, one- or two-word lines.
gram.function: 通过使用一系列极简的、单音节的回答（'Yeah.', 'Uh-huh.', 'No.'），作者创造了一种紧张、克制的对话氛围。这种“断奏式”的交流方式，与杰克急切想知道答案的心情形成对比，突显了萨默因为遵守承诺而刻意保持的距离感。

example.en: A: Ready? B: Yes. A: Scared? B: No.
example.cn: A：准备好了吗？B：好了。A：害怕吗？B：不怕。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对话的节奏来传达潜台词和情感张力的有效技巧。

paras.en: I told him I wouldn't tell you," I explained. "It's so weird," he said. "I have no idea why he's mad at me all of a sudden. None. Can't you at least give me a hint?" I looked over at where August was across the room, talking to our moms. I wasn't about to break my solid oath that I wouldn't tell anyone about what he overheard at Halloween, but I felt bad for Jack. "Bleeding Scream," I whispered in his ear, and then walked away.
paras.cn: “我告诉他我不会告诉你，” 我解释说。“太奇怪了，” 他说。“我完全不知道他为什么突然生我的气。一点都不知道。你至少不能给我一点提示吗？” 我朝房间另一头奥古斯特所在的地方看去，他正在和我们的妈妈们说话。我不会违背我绝不告诉任何人他在万圣节无意中听到了什么的坚定誓言，但我为杰克感到难过。“流血鬼脸，” 我在他耳边低声说，然后走开了。

vocab.ex: It's weird that the store is closed on a Tuesday.
I have no idea where I left my keys.
Can you give me a hint to help me solve the riddle?
In the story, the knight would rather die than break his oath to the king.
We have a solid plan for the future of the company.
I couldn't help but overhear their conversation.
I feel bad for him because he lost his job.

gram.name: 神秘线索与戏剧性退场
gram.pattern: Provide a minimal clue, then leave abruptly.
gram.function: 在一段充满张力的对话后，角色没有直接回答问题，而是给出了一个极其简洁、神秘的线索（'Bleeding Scream'），然后立即离开。这种行为既遵守了她不“说出”秘密的承诺，又巧妙地引导对方去自己发现真相。这个戏剧性的退场为章节制造了一个强有力的悬念，让读者和杰克都急于解开谜底。

example.en: Before disappearing into the night, he whispered only one word: 'Orion.'
example.cn: 在消失在夜色中之前，他只低声说了一个词：“猎户座。”

gram.constraints: 是一种制造悬念和情节转折的经典叙事技巧。
